page.title: 15The Gravel Workings.
page.content: The River Nene flows close to the village and the wide valley was formed by a glacier.In many places between Northampton and Peterborough there are gravel workings.The ones in Ringstead began in 1969. Here the gravel is about five feet below the surface and has an average depth of 10 feet. The first area to be dug was a pool, near the grading plant, to provide water to wash the gravel.Then Ringstead Trout Lake was started. It took two and a half years and produced one and a half million tons of gravel.About ten people work on the ARC site and new sites are still being excavated.On the site of the lake there used to be an old hand-worked sand pit for the people building cottages long ago.
